main event: On September 29, 1952, a 'flying saucer' was reported flying over Hearne, Texas at 2107 hours by a group of people, but the information was garbled due to a poor phone connection and lacked definitive details.
interesting points: The sighting reported a large semi-circular sweep from south to north and a swift exit to the southwest at a high speed.
The object was described as orange-yellow and black in color and was observed to be at an estimated altitude of 20,000 feet.
The report mentions that the observers were not found in the directory of the area, raising doubts about their credibility.
The report suggests that the crew of seven had observed celestial appearances on several occasions, indicating repeated sightings in the area.
The saucer was reported to have no wings, adding to the mystery of the sighting.
